intro: Sonerila ciliata, commonly known as the Ciliate Sonerila, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with cilia along the edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. Sonerila ciliata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
